array.name: faq_question
array.item: Who can register for different programs?
Does Al Dar offer scholarships?
Does Al Dar accept transfer students?
Does Al Dar accept visiting students?
Can I visit the college before admission?
Does Al Dar provide residence visa to the students?
Accordion ContentDoes Al Dar provide transport to the students?
Am I eligible for admission even if I do not have IELTS or TOEFL?
What if I want to change my registration?
What is a pre-requisite course?
How many courses do I need to register?
What are the possibilities of career opportunities available on completion of studies at Al Dar?
Can I pay my fees in installments?
Is there any platform where student(s) can raise their concerns/complaints?

array.name: faq_answer
array.item: All students who fulfill the minimum admission criteria of Al Dar are eligible for the admission and the registration for various programs available at Al Dar University College.

Yes, Al Dar offers a wide range of scholarships and discounts intended to support students in continuing their education. There are many types of scholarships/ grants (High School, sibling, government employee, international student, financial aid) available to the students.
Yes, Al Dar accepts transfer students as per the transfer policy of the Al DarUniversity College.
Yes, Al Dar accepts visiting students based on the permission granted by their university.

Yes, Al Dar gladly welcomes all the prospective students and their parents/relatives to visit the campus and have a campus tour of all the facilities provided to the students. They are also welcome to have interaction with faculties and the staff if they wish so.
Yes, Al Dar provides residence visa to all the admitted students based on the approval of visa request by the UAE Immigration Authority.
Accordion ContentDoes Al Dar provide transport to the students?\nYes, Al Dar provides transportation to the students (morning and evening)for Ajman, Sharjah and Dubai.

Yes, you are eligible for the admission but in that case you will be given provisional/conditional admission and will be limited to 15 credit hours of General Education courses along with Intensive English Program in order to enhance level of your English.
You can change your registration during the drop/add period as per scheduled in the academic calendar.
A pre-requisite course means a course, which a student must pass before enrolling in the advanced course.

The study/course load is the total number of credit hours that student allowed to register during one semester. The maximum registration is 18 credit hours, and the minimum registration is 12 credit hours.

At Al Dar there is a career office which works very closely with the alumni and the corporate sector in order to explore suitable employment opportunities for the students as per their specialization.
Al Dar offers flexible mode of payment in order to facilitate the students in their payment of the fees.
Yes, Al Dar has the policy to Hear from Students. In case, if student(s) have any concerns/complaints they can drop an email at complaints@aldar.ac.ae
